arm_group.description: participants randomised to undergo the renal denervation procedure
participants randomised to the usual care group will receive additional antihypertensive medication in an attempt to achieve blood pressure targets

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a study investigating the effectiveness of renal denervation in lowering blood
      pressure in people whose blood pressure is not adequately controlled despite treatment with
      3 or more blood pressure lowering drugs. The study is designed to compare the effects of
      renal denervation to a usual care group receiving additional blood pressure lowering drugs.

detailed_description.textblock:
Previous studies have shown that the renal denervation procedure is safe and effective in
      reducing blood pressure in patients with resistant hypertension.   A total of 100
      participants with uncontrolled blood pressure, treated with three or more blood pressure
      lowering medications will be recruited into the study. Patients will be assigned to one (1)
      of two (2) groups with the aim of attaining blood pressure control. Participants in group 1
      will be assigned to renal denervation, participants in group 2 will receive additional
      antihypertensive medication according to current guidelines and best practice in an attempt
      to reach blood pressure targets.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  systolic BP ≥140mmHg or ≥130mmHg for patients with diabetes

          -  concurrent treatment with ≥3 anti-hypertensive drugs

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  renal artery anatomy ineligible for treatment

          -  eGFR <15mL/min/1.73m2 (using MDRD calculation)

          -  female participants of childbearing potential must have negative pregnancy test prior
             to treatment

oversight_info.authority: Australia: Department of Health and Ageing Therapeutic Goods Administration

primary_outcome.description: percentage of patients to achieve BP target  (BP <140/90mmHg, or <130/80mmHg in diabetic patients) at 6 months post procedure

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: number of drugs required to reach blood pressure target
secondary_outcome.measure: number of drugs required to reach blood pressure target

secondary_outcome.description: time to achieve blood pressure target
secondary_outcome.measure: time to achieve blood pressure target

secondary_outcome.description: Changes in muscle sympathetic nerve activity (MSNA), renal and whole body NE spillover
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in markers of sympathetic nerve activity

secondary_outcome.description: Change in Left Ventricular mass index, ejection fraction, diastolic filling as assessed by echocardiogram
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Left Ventricular Structure and Function

secondary_outcome.description: Change in Quality of Life as assessed by relevant questionnaires
Plasma renin activity, aldosterone, eGFR, UACR, inflammatory markers, 24hour urinary creatinine clearance, sodium, fasting glucose, fasting insulin, c-peptide, HOMA index, lipid profile
Change in markers of arterial stiffness incduing AI and PWV
secondary_outcome.measure: Change in markers of arterial stiffness

clinical_study.source: Baker IDI Heart and Diabetes Institute

lead_sponsor.agency: Baker IDI Heart and Diabetes Institute

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
